entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 16 at 9:36AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain steady or slowly fall through Minor Flood Stage this week. Residents and interests along the river should be prepared for near Minor to near Moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 16 at 9:34AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at DeLand is forecast to remain within Moderate Flood Stage this week while slowly falling. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts for the foreseeable future.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 16 at 9:32AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through this
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 16 at 9:27AM EST until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 9:44AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: A band of moderate lake effect snow showers over Lake Superior between Munising and Deerton will persist through early afternoon. Those traveling on M-28 in this area should expect quickly changing conditions with visiblity below three quarters of a mile at times and snow covered stretches. The most intense lake effect snow showers should taper off by early afternoon, but light lake
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alger

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 7:46AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: A lake induced low pressure is expected to form today over western Lake Superior and move slowly onshore in the western U.P. tonight through Thursday. Bands of snow showers are possible this afternoon, becoming heavy at times tonight into Thursday. At this time the heaviest snow looks to be within about 20 miles of the lakeshore from Ironwood to Ontonagon. In this area snow amounts
entry.cap:areaDesc: Gogebic; Ontonagon
